::: {.question-block}
<form onsubmit="event.preventDefault(); checkAnswer('module2_mcq_q11')" data-correct-answer="B">
<strong style="display: block;">
If the standard deviation of annual returns is 19.8% and the number of years of observation is 107, what is the standard error of the mean?
</strong>
<label><input type="radio" name="module2_mcq_q11" value="A"> A. 0.47%</label><br>
<label><input type="radio" name="module2_mcq_q11" value="B"> B. 1.91%</label><br>
<label><input type="radio" name="module2_mcq_q11" value="C"> C. 4.23%</label><br>
<label><input type="radio" name="module2_mcq_q11" value="D"> D. 19.8%</label><br>
<label><input type="radio" name="module2_mcq_q11" value="E"> E. 9.9%</label><br>
</form>
<div id="feedback-module2_mcq_q11" class="feedback" data-status="" style="display:none;">
✅ Correct: B. Standard error = σ/√N = 19.8% / √107 ≈ 1.91%.
</div>
:::
